refnamediv.refpurpose: Constructs a user-definable envelope in absolute time.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Constructs a user-definable envelope in absolute time.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: ares transegb ia, itim, itype, ib [, itim2] [, itype] [, ic] ...
kres transegb ia, itim, itype, ib [, itim2] [, itype] [, ic] ...

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ib, ic, etc. -- value after itim seconds.
itim -- time in seconds of end of first segment.
itim2,... itimx etc. -- time in seconds at the end of the segment.

itype, itype2, etc. -- if 0, a straight line is produced. If non-zero, then transegb creates the following curve, for n steps:
ibeg + (ivalue - ibeg) * (1 - exp( i*itype/(n-1) )) / (1 - exp(itype))

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: If itype > 0, there is a slowly rising (concave) or slowly decaying (convex) curve, while if itype < 0, the curve is fast rising (convex) or fast decaying (concave). See also GEN16.
